Davis: Detective ignored lab calls, e-mails

Boston Police Commissioner Edward F. Davis said he took the rare step of stripping an officer of his detective rating after learning that the officer had failed to return phone calls and e-mails to the crime lab testing evidence in the case of a woman who was choked until she passed out.
  • Mourners gather to remember Amy Lord | Detective demoted | Watch Big Story: Amy Lord's funeral

For sale: Lighthouse, needs some work

The Graves Island Light Station, a 110-year-old working lighthouse 9 miles off the Massachusetts coast, went on the auction block in June.

Bill proposes Mass. hosts 2024 Olympics

The bill would create a commission to analyze all aspects of hosting the games, including infrastructure, transportation and security.

Change of Sox for Jake Peavy

The Red Sox added Chicago White Sox righthander and three-time All-Star Jake Peavy to their rotation as part of a three-team, seven-player trade that sent Jose Iglesias to Detroit.

Denver hotel offers stay in pop-up inflatable room

A Denver hotel is offering a package with a one-night stay in a pop-up, inflatable room that rises 22 feet in the air. The cost: $50,000.

The quest for better airline boarding

Some airlines fill planes from the rear and work forward. Others fill window seats and work toward the isle. Still others, like Southwest, let passengers sort things out themselves. So which method works best?

Lawsuit alleges Apple shortchanges store workers

A proposed class-action lawsuit alleges Apple has been mistreating staffers who haven't been paid while forced to wait in line to show they aren't trying to steal merchandise from Apple stores.
